intro: Siphocampylus coltinya, commonly known as the mountain violet, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the Polemoniacaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Siphocampylus coltinya plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
